title: Google Launches Workspace Studio for No-Code AI Agents
comment: Source: TLDR Newsletter, Date: 2025-12-04, Reading time: 3 minute read, Links: https://tracking.tldrnewsletter.com/CL0/https:%2F%2Fworkspaceupdates.googleblog.com%2F2025%2F12%2Fworkspace-studio.html%3Futm_source=tldrai/1/0100019ae9d6d9a1-05f46ead-87a0-49b5-920c-df8a05d4db02-000000/cE-_beiMMuk4oTDZV0cnrleTzbDcahvot95iozADy8M=434
summary: Google Launches Workspace Studio for No-Code AI Agents (3 minute read) Google has launched a workflow builder where you set triggers and define steps, and Gemini handles the fuzzy matching that rigid automation can't, like extracting action items from emails or deciding which messages actually need a response. It connects across Gmail, Drive, Sheets, and third parties like Salesforce and Jira.

title: Touching the Elephant - TPUs
comment: Source: TLDR Newsletter, Date: 2025-12-04, Reading time: 58 minute read, Links: https://tracking.tldrnewsletter.com/CL0/https:%2F%2Fconsiderthebulldog.com%2Ftte-tpu%2F%3Futm_source=tldrai/1/0100019ae9d6d9a1-05f46ead-87a0-49b5-920c-df8a05d4db02-000000/sZVpvtboW2xVjTD_cGdsoGED6wF6Dkl_IjN0HacrhRo=434
summary: Touching the Elephant - TPUs (58 minute read) The development of Google's Tensor Processing Unit (TPU) is a story of trade-offs, constraints, and co-design. It involved working with hardware, software, algorithms, systems, network topology, and everything in between. TPUs did not happen by accident, but through the deliberate process of design and iteration. This article tells the story of how Google created a chip designed with deep learning in mind.

title: Defining Reinforcement Learning Down
comment: Source: TLDR Newsletter, Date: 2025-12-04, Reading time: 4 minute read, Links: https://tracking.tldrnewsletter.com/CL0/https:%2F%2Fwww.argmin.net%2Fp%2Fdefining-reinforcement-learning-down%3Futm_source=tldrai/1/0100019ae9d6d9a1-05f46ead-87a0-49b5-920c-df8a05d4db02-000000/aak_04oJLVrecLe3oamFoSK8V7sysj9FCic70PxgvaY=434
summary: Defining Reinforcement Learning Down (4 minute read) Reinforcement learning (aka post-training) is simpler than it sounds: generate responses, get scores, then retrain while emphasizing the high-scoring ones. If you already have code to pretrain a model, you can turn it into post-training code by adding a single line that weights updates by score.

title: How confessions can keep language models honest
comment: Source: TLDR Newsletter, Date: 2025-12-04, Reading time: 10 minute read, Links: https://tracking.tldrnewsletter.com/CL0/https:%2F%2Flinks.tldrnewsletter.com%2FOB7Aqt/1/0100019ae9d6d9a1-05f46ead-87a0-49b5-920c-df8a05d4db02-000000/CoHoCvI3G3fvU0uXlQkXbZeoPPx1zI5ifRJLdxirIUc=434
summary: How confessions can keep language models honest (10 minute read) When models optimize for correctness, helpfulness, and safety all at once, they can learn shortcuts to “reward hack” while hiding misbehavior in plausible-looking outputs. OpenAI trained a version of GPT-5 to produce a separate "confession" judged only on honesty and found models will admit to reward hacking 90% of the time, even when they hide it in their primary response.

title: System Instructions for Gemini 3 Pro
comment: Source: TLDR Newsletter, Date: 2025-12-04, Reading time: 2 minute read, Links: https://tracking.tldrnewsletter.com/CL0/https:%2F%2Flinks.tldrnewsletter.com%2FGOn8EU/1/0100019ae9d6d9a1-05f46ead-87a0-49b5-920c-df8a05d4db02-000000/6mjU2yuU3Qb82b3XGZlljHnx-vE80wzoZA_OxXnLHtk=434
summary: System Instructions for Gemini 3 Pro (2 minute read) This post provides system instructions for Gemini 3 Pro that improved performance on various agentic benchmarks by up to around 5%. Specific instructions are often required to control how the model reasons, plans, and executes tasks for deep agentic workflows. Complex agents often require a trade-off between computational cost (latency and tokens) and task accuracy. A guide on how to build better agentic workflows is linked in the thread.

summary: Social signals 2025 (2 hour read) A lot has changed since last year, both online and offline. This presentation tries to make sense of all of it. It contains screenshots and news articles collected throughout the year that tell the story of what's been happening.

summary: OpenTelemetry for Dummies - Dash0 Special Edition (Sponsor) Cloud-native apps generate mountains of telemetry. This Dummies Guide helps you make sense of it with practical, step-by-step instructions for instrumenting real-world apps. Get your free copy
